intro: Neurocarpum bracteatum, commonly known as the bracteated neurocarpum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers with distinctive bracts. Its fruits are woody capsules that contain several seeds. Neurocarpum bracteatum is often found in tropical rainforests and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features.
